newsitem.title: GERMANY: Veteran German politician dies at prize ceremony.
newsitem.headline: Veteran German politician dies at prize ceremony.

text.p: Former West German defence minister and one-time Bundestag President Kai-Uwe von Hassel collapsed and died at a political prize ceremony on Thursday, aged 84.

A spokeswoman for Aachen city authorities said the veteran politician collapsed shortly after entering the town hall to attend a ceremony in which German President Roman Herzog was due to be awarded Germany's prestigious Charlemagne prize.
Von Hassel, a member of Germany's Christian Democrats (CDU), was West German defence minister from 1963 to 1965 and president of the Bundestag (lower house of parliament) from 1969 to 1972.
After the Social Democrats (SPD) became the largest party in parliament in the 1972 elections, von Hassel remained a CDU deputy in the Bundestag until 1980 and focused on European politics.
He was a regular guest of honour at the annual ceremony for the Charlemagne prize, launched in 1950 and awarded for promoting European unity, the spokeswoman said.
